definition[0]: if you square two ideas, statements etc with each other or if they square with each other, they are considered to be in agreement
note[0]: square something with your conscience (=make yourself believe that what you are doing is morally right)
example[0]: His story simply does not square with the facts.
example[1]: How do you square that with your religious beliefs?
definition[1]: to persuade someone to agree to something
example[2]: Iâ€™ll take the day off if I can square it with my boss.
definition[2]: to arrange something with someone by persuading them to agree to it or allow it
